notes.title: Gender Studies vs Women's Studies (history, scope, Pakistan status)
notes.content: Define both fields, trace evolution from women's studies (late 1960s) to broader gender studies (including men's/masculinities and queer studies). In Pakistan, women's/gender studies centres began as a government project (1988–89) at major universities; now formal BS/MPhil/PhD programs exist (e.g., PU Lahore, Karachi).
keyTakeaways: Women's Studies focuses on women's experiences and inequality; Gender Studies analyzes gender as a relational, socially constructed system including men/masculinities and LGBTQ+.
Pakistan institutionalization: centres launched 1988–89; journals like PJGS (Karachi) support scholarship.
For exams, contrast scope + methods, and add Pakistan's department examples and curricular outlines.
